alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 10:27PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Tammany, east central Livingston, Tangipahoa and southwestern Washington Parishes through 1100 PM CST... At 1026 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Independence to Hammond to near Springfield. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Ponchatoula, Abita Springs, Independence, Madisonville, Folsom, Springfield, Enon, Natalbany, Robert, Killian, Tickfaw and W Lk Pontchartrain Buoy. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 34 and 64. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 17 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. The heavy rain will also result in reduced visibility on area roadways, including portions of Interstates 12 and 55. Motorists should be prepared for sudden changes in visibility if traveling through the area. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is also occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for southeastern Louisiana.
